Objective.evidence: To assess surgical performance and its impact on the extent of ICH evacuation and functional outcomes.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Greater ICH reduction has a higher likelihood of achieving mRS of 0 to 3 with a minimum evacuation threshold of ≤15 mL end of treatment ICH volume or ≥70% volume reduction when controlling for disease severity factors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: surgical arm (n = 242) of the MISTIE trial.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Greater ICH reduction has a higher likelihood of achieving mRS of 0 to 3 with a minimum evacuation threshold of ≤15 mL end of treatment ICH volume or ≥70% volume reduction when controlling for disease severity factors.
